column1: Limache is a Chilean town and township in the Marga Marga Province
column2: Valparaíso Region. Limache is the only township of Chile that has two urban areas: San Francisco de Limache on the north side of the Pelumpén stream
column3: and Limache Viejo on the south side. Limache is famous for its tomato production and the religious feast of "The Virgin of the 40 Hours" (Spanish: La Virgen de las 40 Horas).

column1: Limache spans an inland area of 293.8 km2 (113 sq mi) in Chile's Zona Central
column2: located 43 km (27 mi) east of the port city of Valparaíso and 103 km (64 mi) northwest of the national capital of Santiago.

column1: The Feast of the Virgin of the 40 Hours (La Fiesta de la Virgen de las 40 Horas) begins in Limache 40 hours before the last Sunday in February with masses every hour
column2: culminating on Sunday with a procession through the city.

column2: Limache is a third-level administrative division of Chile administered by a municipal council
column3: headed by a mayor who is directly elected every four years. The present mayor is Daniel Morales Espíndola (Independent
column4: pro-RN).Within the electoral divisions of Chile
column5: Limache is represented in the Chamber of Deputies by Mr. Marcelo Schilling (PS) and Mr. Arturo Squella (UDI) as part of the 12th electoral district
column8: Quilpué). The township is represented in the Senate by Ignacio Walker Prieto (PDC) and Lily Pérez San Martín (RN) as part of the 5th senatorial constituency (Valparaíso-Cordillera).
